009package imagingbook.common.mser;
010
011import java.util.LinkedList;
012import java.util.List;
013
014import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.mser.components.Component;
016import imagingbook.common.mser.components.ComponentTree;
017import imagingbook.common.mser.components.PixelMap.Pixel;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * Performs "Maximally Stable Extremal Region" (MSER) detection [1] on
022 * gray-scale images. See Chapter 26 of [2] for more details. The constructor
023 * sets up the complete component tree for the specified image but does not
024 * perform feature detection itself, which is done by calling
025 * {@link #getMserFeatures()}.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] J. Matas, O. Chum, M. Urban, and T. Pajdla. Robust widebaseline stereo
029 * from maximally stable extremal regions. Image and Vision Computing 22(10),
030 * 761â€“767 (2004). <br>
031 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
032 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
033 * </p>
034 * 
035 * @author WB
036 * @version 2022/11/23
037 */
038public class MserDetector {
039
040        private final MserParameters params;
041        private final ComponentTree<MserData> compTree;
042        private final double minSizeAbs;
043        private final double maxSizeAbs;
044        private final double maxVar;
045        private final double minDiv;    
046        private final double elapsedTimeMs;
047        
048        private List<Component<MserData>> msers = null; // used to collect MSERs
049        
050        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
051        
052        /**
053         * Constructor using default parameters. 
054         * 
055         * @param ip the input image
056         * @see #MserDetector(ByteProcessor, MserParameters)
057         */
058        public MserDetector(ByteProcessor ip) {
059                this(ip, new MserParameters());
060        }
061
062        /**
063         * Constructor using explicit parameters. A set of parameters can be specified
064         * (see {@link MserParameters}). The constructor sets up the complete component
065         * tree but does not perform feature detection itself, which is done by calling
066         * {@link #getMserFeatures()}.
067         * 
068         * @param ip     the input image
069         * @param params a {@link MserParameters} instance
070         * @see MserParameters
071         */
072        public MserDetector(ByteProcessor ip, MserParameters params) {
073                this.params = params;
074                long startTime = System.nanoTime();
075                
076                // set up the component tree for ip
077                this.compTree = ComponentTree.from(ip, params.method);
078                
079                if (params.validateComponentTree) {
080                        if(!compTree.validate()) {
081                                throw new RuntimeException("component tree not valid");
082                        }
083                }
084
085                attachMserProperties(compTree);
086                calcVariations(compTree, params.delta);
087                markMaximallyStable(compTree);
088                updateStatistics(compTree.getRoot());   // calcPointStatistics(compTree);
089
090                int imgSize = ip.getWidth() * ip.getHeight();
091                
092                this.minSizeAbs = 
093                                Math.max((int) (imgSize * params.minRelCompSize), params.minAbsComponentArea);
094                this.maxSizeAbs = (int) (imgSize * params.maxRelCompSize);
095                this.maxVar = params.maxSizeVariation;
096                this.minDiv = params.minDiversity;
097                
098                this.elapsedTimeMs = (System.nanoTime() - startTime) / 1000000.0;
099        }
100
101        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
102        
103        /**
104         * Extracts and returns a list of MSER components. Features are extracted
105         * only once and cached for subsequent calls.
106         * 
107         * @return a list of extracted MSER components
108         */
109        public List<Component<MserData>> getMserFeatures() {
110                if (this.msers == null) {
111                        this.msers = new LinkedList<>();
112                        collectMsers(compTree.getRoot(), Integer.MAX_VALUE);
113                }
114                return this.msers;
115        }
116        
117        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
118
119        /**
120         * Attach Mser data to all region tree components.
121         * @param tree
122         */
123        private void attachMserProperties(ComponentTree<MserData> tree) {
124                for (Component<MserData> c : tree) {
125                        c.setProperties(new MserData(c));
126                }
127        }
128        
129        /**
130         * New version, works on components in any order.
131         * @param compTree
132         * @param delta
133         */
134        private void calcVariations(ComponentTree<MserData> compTree, int delta) {
135                for (Component<MserData> c : compTree) {                
136                        c.getProperties().variation = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
137                        Component<?> p = c.getParent();
138                        if (p != null) {        // c is not root
139                                final int ld = c.getLevel() + delta;
140                                Component<?> cc = c;
141                                
142                                // find the next ancestor component (p) whose level val(p) >= vd :
143                                while (p != null && p.getLevel() < ld) {
144                                        // IJ.log("        hiC=" + hiC.ID + " hiC.parent.level=" + hiC.getParent().getLevel());
145                                        cc = p;                 // climb upward
146                                        p = cc.getParent();
147                                }
148                                if (p != null) {        // cc is not the root -->  pp.getLevel() >= vd
149                                        // calculate growth and assign to c
150                                        float ac  = c.getSize();                // size of the current component (c)
151                                        float acc = cc.getSize();               // size of the upper component (cc)
152                                        c.getProperties().variation = (acc - ac) / ac;
153                                }
154                        }
155                }
156        }
157        
158        /**
159         * We start from the root and walk down recursively.
160         * Every node is only visited once.
161         */
162        private void markMaximallyStable(ComponentTree<MserData> compTree) {
163                // initially assume all components are max. stable
164                for (Component<MserData> c : compTree) {
165                        Component<MserData> p = c.getParent();
166                        if (p == null) {                                        // the root is always unstable
167                                c.getProperties().isStable = false;
168                        }
169                        else if (c.getLevel() + 1 == p.getLevel()) {
170                                float vp = p.getProperties().variation;
171                                float vc = c.getProperties().variation;
172                                
173                                if (vc < vp) {
174                                        p.getProperties().isStable = false;
175                                }
176                                else if (vc > vp) {
177                                        c.getProperties().isStable = false;
178                                }
179                        }
180                }
181        }
182
183        /**
184         * Calculates point (coordinate) statistics for all tree components.
185         * We start at the forest root nodes and walk down recursively
186         * toward the leaf nodes. Each component carries a 5-element
187         * {@code long} vector of sums, where each element is the sum 
188         * of the corresponding elements over all child components.
189         * @param c the current component
190         * @return a 5-element vector of coordinate sums
191         */
192        private long[] updateStatistics(Component<MserData> c) {
193                if (c.getProperties().stats != null) {
194                        throw new RuntimeException(this.getClass().getSimpleName() + ": sums array should not exist yet!");
195                }
196                long[] m = new long[5];
197                //              if (c.sums == null) {
198                //                      c.sums = new long[5];
199                //              }
200                //              else {
201                //                      Arrays.fill(c.sums, 0);
202                //              }
203                // add local point statistics
204                for (Pixel p : c.getLocalPixels()) {
205                        final long x = p.x;
206                        final long y = p.y;
207                        m[0] += x;
208                        m[1] += y;
209                        m[2] += x * x;
210                        m[3] += y * y;
211                        m[4] += x * y;
212                }
213
214                for (Component<MserData> child : c.getChildren()) {
215                        long[] sc = updateStatistics(child);
216                        for (int i = 0; i < sc.length; i++) {
217                                m[i] += sc[i];
218                        }
219                }
220                c.getProperties().stats = m;
221                //              IJ.log("updateStatistics: " + c.toString() + " " + Arrays.toString(c.sums));
222                return m;
223        }
224
225        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
226        
227        /**
228         * Checks and collects component 'c' into {@link #msers}'.
229         * Started from a root component, recursively walks toward the leaf
230         * components.
231         * Diversity is the size ratio between collected components on the same
232         * path. I.e., to be eligible, the current component must be significantly smaller than
233         * the previously collected component. This starts with the largest component.
234         * @param c the current component
235         * @param ap the size of the closest ancestor component marked as MSER
236         */
237        private void collectMsers(Component<MserData> c, int ap) {
238                //IJ.log("collecting " + c.ID + " / " + msers.size());
239                int ac = c.getSize();           // the current component's size
240                //double diversity = (ap - ac) / (double) ap;
241
242                MserData props = c.getProperties();
243                if (props.isStable && 
244                                minSizeAbs <= ac && ac <= maxSizeAbs && 
245                                props.variation <= maxVar && 
246                                ((ap - ac) / (double) ap) >= minDiv) {
247                        
248                        //Mser mser = new Mser(c);                      // create a candidate MSER (with ellipse)
249                        props.init();
250                        double ellipseArea = props.getEllipse().getArea();
251                        double compactness = ac / ellipseArea;
252                        // ignore MSERs whose ellipse is too big (if turned on)
253                        // ignore MSERs whose size is much smaller than the associated ellipse (i.e., not compact at all)
254                        if ((!params.constrainEllipseSize || ellipseArea <= maxSizeAbs) && 
255                                        compactness > params.minCompactness) {
256                                this.msers.add(c); //this.msers.add(mser);
257                                ap = ac;
258                                props.isMserP = true;   // mark component c as a selected MSER
259                        }
260                }
261                
262                if (ac > minSizeAbs) { // continue unless size is too small
263                        // recursively collect components from all children:
264                        for (Component<MserData> child : c.getChildren()) {
265                                collectMsers(child, ap);
266                        }
267                }
268        }
269
270        /**
271         * Returns the component tree for this MSER detector.
272         * 
273         * @return the component tree
274         */
275        public ComponentTree<MserData> getComponentTree() {
276                return compTree;
277        }
278
279        /**
280         * Returns the time required for the MSER detector to process the
281         * associated image (in milliseconds).
282         * 
283         * @return time required for MSER detection (ms)
284         */
285        public double getElapsedTime() {
286                return elapsedTimeMs;
287        }
288
289}
